result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes

defendant.name: Fernandez-Reyes, Cesar O
defendant.address: 36 Reid Terrace #3, Fond du Lac, WI 54935

records.addlTxt: 1:47 PM / Room 301. Defendant Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes appeared by video, in custody at the Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Robert Thomas Ruth appeared by video for Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes.  Attorney Kelly L Hays appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Susan Rascon appears as Interpreter. All appearances are by Zoom. 22CF22 and 22CF63.  Susan Rascon sworn in as interpreter. Court has reviewed record and bond modification request. Attny Ruth makes argument for bond modification, asks for $40,000 bond. State is in compliance with victim rights and notification law. State objects to modification, gives reasoning. Response by Attny Ruth. Remarks by the Court. The Court denies modification request. Attny Ruth indicates in the process of scheduling a hearing for a discovery issue. STC already set for Dec., court advises counsel to continue to work with JA for further scheduling. Adj. at 2:06 p.m.

10:38 AM /Room 301/ Court calls cases 22CF22 & 22CF63. Defendant Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Robert Thomas Ruth appeared by video for Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Susan Rascon in court. Interpreter Susan Rascon is sworn in. Same appearances on both cases. Motion requesting bond reduction. Defendant's atty requests waiver of right to preliminary hearing. State does not want to address bond reduction motion at this time. Remarks by court. State recommends more time for notice for victim. Remarks by court to state. Defendant's atty is agreeable to delay bond modification if hearing can be set promptly. Court advises to schedule with JA. Court advises defendant of rights. Court reviews risks and benefits. No remarks by defendant. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing on both cases. Court finds probable cause and binds case over. Defendant's atty received copy of information. Defendant's atty requests reading of charges. Court reads charges information. Court advises defendant of penalties in both cases. No remarks by defendant's atty. Defendant's atty pleads not guilty on all counts. Court receives not guilty pleas on all charges in both cases. Defendant's atty intends to file discovery and requests status hearing. Remarks by court to defendant. STC set for December 5th @ 11:00 AM by zoom. State has complied with victims rights and will schedule time with JA for bond hearing. Defendant questions court as to bond and dates.
Amend Bail/Bond Conditions - Routed to CC-JA

11:46 AM in Room 301.     22CF22 and 22CF63.   Defendant Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes in court, via Zoom, with attorney Robert Thomas Ruth in person.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.  Defendant Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes in custody.  Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes appeared by video means with Attorney. Susan Rascon, appears in person, sworn in as interpreter.  Attny Ruth requests preliminary hearing, waives time limits. Attny Ruth has discussed P.H. rights with Def.  Court explains rights to P.H. Def understands. Def. wants P.H. but will waive time limits. The Court accepts waiver of time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 017753,
Payable Number: 66133,
Receipt Number: 22R 002182,
Amount: $20.00

02:33 PM/Rm. 203/Defendant Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reporter by Zoom.  Interpreter appears by telephone.  Court calls 22-CF-22 and 22-CF-63.  Susan Rascon, duly sworn as interpreter.  Court advises Def. of charges and penalties.  Def. given right to attorney and options.  Def. has called public defender.  Def. wants to wait for attorney.  Court advises Def. he can wait, hire his own attorney or apply for court appointed attorney.  Recess 3:00 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No contact with child victim. 
No contact with any minor children. 
No leaving the state of Wisconsin.
Surrender passport to Langlade County Sheriff's Department.

01:37 PM Defendant Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes in court, in custody. Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cesar O Fernandez-Reyes appeared by video means. Court calls 22CF22 and 22CF63. Def. has copy of complaints, advised of charges and penalties of both cases.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. chooses to hire an attorney. ADA makes argument and gives recommendation of $100,000.00 for both cases with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, absolute sobriety, no contact with victim, no contact with any minor children, no leaving the state of Wisconsin and surrender passport. Def. makes response. The court orders an interpreter in person or by telephone for future hearings. An adjourned initial appearance is scheduled 4/18/22 at 02:30pm. Defendant questions the court and makes statement. Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
